title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
metaDescription: Parent curriculum guide for Animal Farm. See what your child will learn week by week.
outcomes: Connecting textual analysis to historical context

weeks.title: Understanding the Text
weeks.description: Building foundational understanding of the allegory
topics: Introduction to Animal Farm and Russian Revolution context
Understanding the farm setting and character parallels
Meeting the animals and their symbolic roles

weeks.title: How the Text Works
weeks.description: Discovering how Orwell constructs political satire
topics: Exploring the central pattern: Power Corruption
Recognising recurring motifs (Seven Commandments, songs, slogans)
Analysing how allegory conveys political critique

weeks.title: Analysing Key Techniques
weeks.description: Learning to identify and analyse Orwell's techniques
topics: Technique 1: Allegory (animal characters as historical figures)
Collecting textual evidence for each technique

weeks.title: Building the Argument
weeks.description: Developing a thesis and analytical argument
topics: Exploring the guiding question: How does Orwell use allegory to reveal how revolutionary ideals are corrupted by those who seize power?

weeks.title: Writing the Introduction
topics: Drafting and refining the introduction paragraph

technique.name: Allegory
technique.description: Each animal character represents historical figures and social classes, allowing Orwell to critique Stalinism through accessible narrative.

weeks.title: Body Paragraph 2
topics: Building on analytical skills from Week 6

technique.name: Satire
technique.description: Orwell's satirical tone mocks totalitarian rhetoric, exposing the gap between revolutionary promises and dictatorial reality.

technique.name: Propaganda Language
technique.description: Squealer's manipulative language demonstrates how propaganda distorts truth and maintains power through deception.
